{{also|reis|reís|réis}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ʀaɪ̯s/}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯s}} * {{audio|de|De-Reis.ogg|audio}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|gmh|rīs}}, borrowed from {{etyl|LL.|de}} ''risum'' or ''risus'', from {{der|de|la|oriza}}, borrowed from {{der|de|grc|ὄρυζα}} (Modern Greek {{m|el|όρυζα}}). See also English {{m|en|rice}}.{{R:EWddS|ed=22}} ====Noun==== {{de-noun|m|Reises|Reise}} # [[rice]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|es|e}} =====Derived terms===== {{der3|de|Arvorioreis|Basmatireis|Cargoreis|Langkornreis|Milchreis|Naturreis|Patnareis|Perlreis|Puffreis|Reisbau|Reisbauer|Reisernte|Reisfeld|Reisgericht|Reisimport|Reiskorn|Reismehl|Reispflanze|Reisproduktion|Reisstärke|Wildreis|Reisstärling}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|de|gmh|rīs}}, from {{inh|de|goh|rīs}}, {{m|goh|hrīs}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*hrīsą}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|rijs}}, {{cog|en|rise}}, {{m|en|rice}}. More at {{l|en|rice}} {{i|Etymology 2}}. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|n|Reises|Reiser}} # [[shoot]] (of a plant) =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|Es ist ein Ros entsprungen}} ** Usage note: The line Es ist ein Ros entsprungen originally meant a shoot of a trunk, concerning Isaiah 11 in the Bible. Later the line was understood as a rose, concerning Mary. More at https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Es_ist_ein_Ros_entsprungen ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|es|er}} ===Etymology 3=== ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|de|Reales}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|/ʀɛɪ̯s/}} * {{rhymes|de|ɛɪ̯s}} ====Noun==== {{head|de|noun form}} # {{plural of|de|Real}} ===References=== [[Category:de:Foods]] [[Category:de:Grains]] ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/raɪ̯s/}} ===Noun=== {{head|hrx|noun|g=m}} # [[rice]] ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Plautdietsch== ===Noun=== {{head|pdt|noun|g=f|plural|Reisen}} # [[journey]], [[trip]] [[Category:Plautdietsch one-syllable nouns]]
